name: label-dilate
author: Connectome Workbench Developers
description:
Dilate a label file.

Fills in label information for all vertices designated as bad, up to the specified distance away from other labels.  If -bad-vertex-roi is specified, all vertices, including those with the unlabeled key, are good, except for vertices with a positive value in the ROI.  If it is not specified, only vertices with the unlabeled key are bad.

inputs.name: dilate_dist
inputs.description: distance in mm to dilate the labels

inputs.name: opt_bad_vertex_roi_roi_metric
inputs.description: specify an roi of vertices to overwrite, rather than vertices with the unlabeled key: metric file, positive values denote vertices to have their values replaced

inputs.name: opt_column_column
inputs.description: select a single column to dilate: the column number or name

inputs.name: opt_corrected_areas_area_metric
inputs.description: vertex areas to use instead of computing them from the surface: the corrected vertex areas, as a metric
